intro: Microstigma deflexum, commonly known as the flexed microstigma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, branched stems and trifoliate leaves, which are compound and have three leaflets. It is native to certain regions of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
